title: Menus
description: Menus are where it all starts in the plugin

values.name: Menu-Type
description: The type of this menu, one of the following:
'Chest', 'Hopper', 'Dispenser', 'Dropper', 'Crafting'
If the type is 'Chest', or it is not specified, see #Rows

values.name: Rows
description: If #Menu-Type is set to 'Chest' or not set, this is used
A number of 1 through 6 that specifies the amount of rows in the menu

values.name: Permission
values.description: The permission required to open this menu

values.name: Permission-Message
values.description: The message to send when the player does not have the Permission

values.name: Title-Update-Delay
values.description: The interval in ticks between each title update

values.name: Menu-Opener
values.description: The item to use to open the menu, format is <type>:<amount>:<data>

values.name: Menu-Opener-Name
values.description: The display name #Menu-Opener must have to open the menu

values.name: Menu-Opener-Lore
values.description: The lore #Menu-Opener must have to open the menu

values.name: Menu-Opener-Slot
values.description: The slot to put #Menu-Opener in when a player joins

values.name: Open-On-Join
values.description: Whether the menu should open when a player joins

values.name: Open-Sound
description: The sound to play when the menu is opened, in format <sound>[:<volume>[:<pitch>]]

NOTE: This uses /playsound command names. For a list of sounds, see @{http://www.minecraftforum.net/forums/mapping-and-modding/mapping-and-modding-tutorials/1571574-all-minecraft-playsound-file-names-1-9|this page}

values.name: Command
description: The command to type to open the menu
Use ; to specify multiple commands, e.g. 'command1; command2'
This can also be a section, where you can specify more stuff:
===CODE YAML===
Command:
Name: 'somecommand'
Usage: '/somecommand'
Description: Opens a menu
Lenient-Args: true
If Lenient-Args is set to false and a player was to enter too many arguments in the command, it would fail

values.name: Hide-From-Command
values.description: Prevent this menu from being openable through /animatedmenu open

values.name: Click-Delay
values.description: The delay (in ticks) that a player must wait before clicking an item again

values.name: Delay-Message
description: The message to send when #Click-Delay is not over yet
You can use these special placeholders to customize the message:
*{hoursleft}* to retrieve the amount of hours left
*{minutesleft}* to retrieve the amount of minutes left in the hour
*{secondsleft}* to retrieve the amount of seconds left in the minute
*{ticksleft}* to retrieve the amount of ticks left in the second
You can use formulas (e.g. \(20{secondsleft} + {ticksleft})) to get a total of something

values.name: Items
description: The items to put in this menu
See the @{items.md|Items} page for info on how to set this up

values.name: Open-Animation
description: The animation to play when the menu opens, in format <type>[:<speed>].
<type> can be a custom animation specified in config.yml, or one of:
down, up, right, left
up-left, up-right, down-left, down-right
out, in
snake-down, snake-up, snake-right, snake-left

values.name: Empty-Item
description: The item to put in empty slots, see @{items.md|Items} for the format.
If you set 'Single' to 'true', the item will only be loaded once when opening the menu instead of repeating it for each item.
Setting it would look something like this:
===CODE YAML===
Empty-Item:
Name: '&6Empty Item'
Material: stone
Single: true

values.name: Open-Commands
values.description: The commands to perform when the menu opens, see @{click_handlers.md#commands|Commands}

values.name: Close-Commands
values.description: The commands to perform when the menu closes, see @{click_handlers.md#commands|Commands}

values.name: Sql-Await
description: A comma-separated list of Sql Queries to request before opening the menu
This happens asynchronously, which means that your server won't be paused by this
You can use #Wait-Message to specify a message to send when waiting

values.name: Wait-Message
values.description: The message to send when waiting for Sql-Await to complete

values.name: Admin
description: Set to 'true' to make this an administrative menu. When this is the case:
The menu is hidden from /animatedmenu open
The menu can only be opened through a custom command by using /<command> <player>
You can then use %menuadmin_<placeholder>% to use <placeholder> as the target player
%menuadmin_player_name% would retrieve the target player's name
When switching between admin menus, the target player will retain until the menu is closed

values.name: Require-Other
description: When #Admin is enabled, this specifies whether another player needs to be specified
If this is set to 'false', the effects of #Admin no longer apply and the menuadmin placeholder uses the player itself

values.name: Save-Navigation
description: When set to 'true', any navigation to other menus will be saved
This will make a player open the last opened menu when opening this menu
If you have some sort of paged shop, this can be quite useful
